meanings.definition: Boastful or arrogant in speech or behavior.
meanings.sent1: She always acts so vaunty when she talks about her accomplishments.
meanings.sent2: His vaunty attitude often rubs people the wrong way.
meanings.sent3: Despite his vaunty claims, no one believed he could fly without wings.
meanings.sent4: Her vaunty demeanor was like a bright neon sign demanding attention.
meanings.sent5: The peacock strutted around the farm, its vaunty display captivating onlookers.

meanings.definition: Characterized by excessive pride or vanity.
meanings.sent1: The queen's vaunty behavior made her unpopular among the commoners.
meanings.sent2: He was so vaunty about his appearance that he spent hours in front of the mirror.
meanings.sent3: The vaunty cat refused to acknowledge the existence of the other pets in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her vaunty castle stood tall, a symbol of her excessive pride and wealth.
meanings.sent5: The vaunty peacock preened its feathers, oblivious to the world around it.
